info.name: OsmoX-API

request.description: Allows successfully creating new notification for the SMTP channel type.

item.description: These API calls pertain to notification creation. It consists of list of APIs which allow you to create a notification of your desired Channel Type. OsmoX will process and send the created notifications.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Allows successfully logging in and obtaining the auth token from API.

item.description: These API calls pertain to authentication actions, such as logging in as a specific user.

item.name: Notification

graphql.query:
query {
  notifications(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "applicationId", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    notifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all notifications based on the options passed.

item.name: Fetch Active or Archived Notification by Id

graphql.query:
query {
  notification(
    notificationId: 150
  ) {
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching single notification based on the options passed.

item.description: These API calls are responsible for fetching notifications and related details.

graphql.query:
query {
  archivedNotifications(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "applicationId", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    archivedNotifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationId
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all notifications based on the options passed.

item.name: Provider Request Confirmation

request.description:
Mailgun tracks every inbound and outbound message event and retains this data for at least 3 days.

Reference: [https://documentation.mailgun.com/docs/mailgun/api-reference/openapi-final/tag/Events/#tag/Events/operation/get-v3-domain_name-events](https://documentation.mailgun.com/docs/mailgun/api-reference/openapi-final/tag/Events/#tag/Events/operation/get-v3-domain_name-events)
Reference: [https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource)
Reference: [https://www.plivo.com/docs/messaging/api/message#message-status-callbacks](https://www.plivo.com/docs/messaging/api/message#message-status-callbacks)
Reference: [https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource)
Reference: [https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/api/message-resource#fetch-a-message-resource)
Reference: [https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource#fetch-a-call-resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource#fetch-a-call-resource)

item.name: Provider Chain

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all provider chains based on the options passed.

item.description: These API calls are responsible for all operations related to Provider Chains such as creation, display etc.

item.name: Provider Chain Member

graphql.query:
query {
  providerChainMembers(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: ASC
    #   filters: [{ field: "providerId", operator: "gt", value: "5" }]
    }
  ) {
    providerChainMembers{
        id
        chainId
        providerChainDetails {
            chainId
            chainName
            description
            providerType
            applicationId
            createdOn
            updatedOn
            status
        }
        priorityOrder
        isActive
        providerId
        providerDetails {
            providerId
            name
            channelType
            isEnabled
            configuration
            applicationId
            userId
            status
        }
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all provider chain members based on the options passed.

item.name: Update Chain Member Provider Priority Order

item.description: These API calls are responsible for all operations related to Provider Chain Members such as creation, display etc.
